channel.title: Another N1 Reaper Deb Topic
channel.description: Let's face it, if Reaper gets debauched night one he should just leave the game. There is no counterplay, he already lost and Possessor and Sorcerer don't have this problem. They can't be debauched and in fact can use abilities night one that let them kill without even visiting their target. Reaper can't empower reap night one anymore and I think this should be reverted ...

item.title: Another N1 Reaper Deb Topic
item.dc:creator: Aquillion
item.description:
Eran_Shmuel:

Reaper is the strongest NK and he doesn’t need a buff. Somtimes you get unlucky thats life.

I’m not sure (Reaper has a stronger endgame than Possessor, but is weaker early on and in the midgame), but either way, NKs as a whole are underpowered, so even if he were the best that would be damning with faint praise.

But either way, this is a very minor buff that would mostly just prevent Drunks from randomly finding them with one visit. Since NKs are a solo side, and since they’re supposed to be a major factor in the game, it shouldn’t generally be possible for a single visit to decisively identify them. (And being identified by the Drunk is particularly bad - Drunks can prove fairly well with their will, and can also use HH to shut you down for a while even if nobody believes them.)

item.title: Another N1 Reaper Deb Topic
item.dc:creator: Aquillion
item.description:
He won’t know to empower anyway, so empowering isn’t really a solution unless you think Reapers empowering N1 every single time could become the meta.

Simpler solution: Change Reap so it doesn’t produce a message to the victim if they’re immune. That means a Reaper can deb you (costing you a night), but you won’t be outed by it because they won’t see that you tried to attack them.

This would somewhat nerf the Drunk (removing their ability to find an NK they previously could), but I think it’ll be fine. Drunk already has lots of powers and technically isn’t even an Investigative to begin with. I mean… Drunk is nearly a flat upgrade to the Butler, they don’t need the ability to find Reapers.
